evidence: Clear separation of concerns with dedicated modules: 'models', 'services', 'utils', and core components
Presence of a unified entry point through 'enhanced_rest_client.py' acting as an integration facade
Internal services (e.g., order_service, price_service) depend on each other but are organized by business capability
Use of dependency inversion where higher-level modules depend on abstractions (e.g., BaseTradingStrategy)
No evidence of distributed deployment or microservices communication patterns
Single setup.py indicating a single deployable unit
Tests are co-located and follow modular structure, supporting modular monolith organization
risks: Tight coupling between internal modules could emerge over time without strict enforcement of boundaries
Lack of explicit ports and adapters pattern may lead to infrastructure concerns leaking into business logic
As the system grows, module interdependencies may become harder to manage without clear layering
